subject: Gardening
title: The English Landscape Garden
description: A quick, practical guide to The English Landscape Garden.

hook.text: English landscape gardens were designed to look natural. Ironically, that 'naturalness' required massive engineering.

buildup.text: Capability Brown redesigned over 170 estates, replacing formal gardens with rolling lawns, lakes.

discovery.text: Brown moved hills, dammed rivers for lakes, and planted thousands of treesâ€”all to simulate 'natural' scenery.

twist.text: The style destroyed formal gardens and whole villages. Peasants were relocated so aristocrats could enjoy 'nature.'

climax.text: The English landscape garden is the most influential design movement in historyâ€”and the most artificially natural.

punchline.text: The world's most 'natural' gardens were entirely manufactured.

quiz.question: What controversial practice accompanied the English landscape garden movement?
options: Ancient forests were clear-cut to create open lawns
Entire villages were demolished and peasants relocated for aesthetic views
Exotic species were imported that became invasive
